intro: Acianthera majakoluckae, commonly known as the Majakolucka orchid, is a rare and endemic species native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its unique floral structure, featuring intricate patterns and vibrant colors. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments, often in cloud forests or rainforests. Its flowers are pollinated primarily by specific insect species, contributing to its ecological significance. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered a conservation concern.
